content:
Hello everyone, I'm Florian.

I'm programming for around 7/8 years now. My primary language for a long time has been Java, but I've also worked Python, C#, Php, JavaScript and some others. I'm using rust for around one year, though my first attempt at using it is probably 2 years ago already. I haven't really finished any project using rust yet, but I've still got some things I'm working on.

Happy to help wherever it's needed :)
Hello Florian, welcome to the project! Is there any particular area you're interested in working on?
Gotcha. In that case a good place to start might be E-easy issues or documentation you notice is out of place: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/labels/E-easy

That looks good. How would I start working on something? Do I just work on the issue and open a pr at some point? I didn't really find a good starting point in the documentation, so I'm a little unsure on how to start working on an issue...
You can claim an issue to show you’re working on it by sending @rustbot claim on the issue
I’d suggest you to read the Contributing to Rust chapter of the rustc-dev-guide
Alright gonna have an in depth look again, I only skimmed it so far. Can I get back here if I should have further questions?

Florian Warzecha said:

I didn't really find a good starting point in the documentation, so I'm a little unsure on how to start working on an issue...

yeah ... the dev-guide could use some work for getting started
right now it's a great reference but not a great guide
if you need an issue to work on, feel free to leave me a message here :smile:
I've currently started working on one of the issue E-easy issues, but I'll come back to that offer, thank you :)
